intro: Eryngium ternatum, commonly known as purple thistle or sea holly, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It features striking blue to purple spiny flowers that bloom in summer, surrounded by finely divided, silver-gray foliage. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves and grows up to 3 feet tall, with a stiff, upright stem. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardens and native plant landscapes. Botanically, it belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence.
